Class GripperPosition

java.lang.Object
  GripperPosition

public class GripperPosition
extends java.lang.Object

This class can store a gripper position. A gripper position is a point where the gripper is, a normal vector at that point representing the direction of the gripper, an angle at which the gripper is aligned and finally a value representing how open the gripper is.

This class also includes methods for converting a gripper position to a string and for checking if another gripper position is equal to the one stored in the class.

Version:
$Id: GripperPosition.java,v 1.8 2003/04/17 09:22:58 mtjspaan Exp $
Author:
Nikos Massios, Matthijs Spaan

Field Detail

coords

public Point coords
The point where the gripper is. It is measured in mm from the origin.

normal

public Vector3D normal
The normal vector of the gripper. It is normal to the board and since the board is usually flat on a table it is usually just (0,0,1).

theta

public double theta
The angle of the gripper. It is measured in degrees.

grip

public double grip
The opening of the gripper. It is measured in mm. The useful range is 0-50, 0 is closed 50 is very open.

Constructor Detail

GripperPosition

public GripperPosition(Point coords,
                       Vector3D normal,
                       double theta,
                       double grip)
This is the full constructor. It uses its arguments to initialise the class fields coords, normal, theta and grip.

Parameters:
coords - The point where the gripper is.
normal - The normal at that point.
theta - The angle of the gripper.
grip - The opening of the gripper.
See Also:
coords, normal, theta, grip

GripperPosition

public GripperPosition(Point coords,
                       double theta,
                       double grip)
This constructor sets the class field normal to (0,0,1). It uses its arguments to initialise the class fields coords, theta and grip.

Parameters:
coords - The point where the gripper is.
theta - The angle of the gripper.
grip - The opening of the gripper.
See Also:
coords, normal, theta, grip
Method Detail

equals

public boolean equals(GripperPosition p)
This method checks if another gripper position equals this one.

Parameters:
p - The other gripper position.
Returns:
True if they are equal and False otherwise.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
This method converts the gripper position to a string.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A string representing the gripper position. The format of the returned string is [(coords),(normal),theta,grip].

read

public static void read(java.util.Vector p)
This method reads the gripper positions in a vector. It reads the gripper positions from the file positions.txt into a vector of gripper positions. Each element of the vector p becomes a GripperPosition class object.

Parameters:
p - The vector to put the gripper positions to.

write

public static void write(java.util.Vector p)
This method stores in a file a vector of gripper positions. It writes a vector of positions to the file positions.txt Each element of the vector p should be a GripperPosition class object.

Parameters:
p - The vector of gripper positions to write.
